intro: Calendula dalgesirum, commonly known as the common marigold, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calendula dalgesirum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
